data.sampled: Yes, 2 kilograms of eggshells weighs more than 1 kilogram of gold bars. An eggshell has density 0.5 grams per cubic centimeter (g/cm³) while the density of gold bar is about 19 g/cm³. Therefore, one kilogram of eggshells contains 2 kg × 1000 cm³ = 2000 cm³ more volume than one kilogram of gold bars. This means that two kilograms of eggshells have greater weight.

data.sampled:
Yes, the weight of 12 pounds of hydrogen is more than 10 pounds of palladium. The weight of an object is determined by its mass, which is the amount of matter it contains. Therefore, when two objects have the same number of atoms or molecules but different masses, the one with the higher mass will weigh more. In this case, we can compare the weights of 12 pounds of hydrogen and 10 pounds of palladium:

12 pounds of hydrogen (made up of 1 part Hydrogen per 2 parts oxygen) has a mass of 4.184 kilograms, while
10 pounds of palladium (made up of 100% Palladium metal) has a mass of 0.0105 kilograms.

So even though both substances contain equal amounts of hydrogen (or palladium), the much larger size and greater density of the palladium mean that it weighs less overall. Thus, 12 pounds of hydrogen outweighs 10 pounds of palladium in terms of weight.

prompt.content: You are a helpful assistant.
Is 12 pounds of hydrogen heavier than 10 pounds of palladium? Answer Yes or No
